Articles.Content:
Now that were planning 'secret' missions to mars.. we'll need a refueling stop (plus restaurant/coffee shop) on the nearby rocks for the Nauts to recoup. Maybe we'll throw in a bar next door with some entertainment such as dancing aliens. ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)

Testing all sorts of configs...

![3gayFyQ.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/3gayFyQ.jpg)

![IPPXCfO.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/IPPXCfO.jpg)

![PDsrNAT.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/PDsrNAT.jpg)

Ever so gentle landing on Phobos.. and it just sinks into the ground... and explodes ![:mad:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_angry.gif)

I wanted to get out and have a look at the Grand Amphitheater on the left....

Can you land on these small moons ??

coming in.. sooooo slowly

![vzUZ4Mj.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/vzUZ4Mj.jpg)

Going down at about 0.1 ms.. it took a while

![ADGRF8e.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/ADGRF8e.jpg)

Instead of stopping at the feet... my space ship turns into a submarine ![:rolleyes:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_rolleyes.gif)

![Nt2Qdus.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/Nt2Qdus.jpg)

The finale...

![tbWJKMN.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/tbWJKMN.jpg)
Mars' moons are notorious for being rather buggy. In fact Gilly was once like that.
Something is wrong. Not sure what. I do know I landed OK on Phobos in 1.0...

I F9'd and landed up one level to the right.. 

It sank again, but must have hit something solid with the back legs it and the front section looked like it was on as well.

I then shut down all systems and when turning off SAS.. the front sank and it exploded again (SAS was holding it up ??)

Same situation for both Phobos and Deimos

It's as if the 'height map' and 'collision barrier' are at two different levels.. if there are such things in the game?

Oh yes before I forget.. I'm still playing V090... --> Is RSS out for V1.0 ?

**Edited <time datetime="2015-06-06T21:11:24Z" title="06/06/2015 09:11  PM" data-short="9 yr">June 6, 2015</time> by ColKlonk**
